attributes.action: Improving Hyperemesis Gravidarum (HG) care in hospitals and GP practices throughout the UK
attributes.additional_details:
We, the undersigned, ask the Department of Health to ensure that: EVERY woman is routinely given accurate information about HG during antenatal care; every  woman is offered medication  in pregnancy. HG is a pregnancy condition which often goes undiagnosed and untreated.

Treatment for pregnant women would reduce abortions and repeated hospital admissions for moderate to severe cases.

30% of all hospital admissions under 20 weeks are for HG yet actual diagnosis figures do not reflect this.

rejection.details: Neither the Department of Health nor the Government are responsible for the care given to individual patients, which is a matter for trained clinicians.
